title: Here is a reading list of 20 articles up to 2023 that focus on indirectly supervised natural language processing (NLP). These articles cover a range of topics including semi-supervised learning, weak supervision, and other forms of indirect supervision in NLP

author.literal: **"Semi-Supervised Sequence Learning"** - Andrew M. Dai, Quoc V. Le

title: **"Learning from Noisy Labels with Deep Neural Networks: A Survey"** - Jindong Wang, et al
**"Weakly Supervised Learning of Semantic Parsers for Mapping Instructions to Actions"** - Tom Kwiatkowski, et al
**"Snorkel: Rapid Training Data Creation with Weak Supervision"** - Alex Ratner, et al
**"Bootstrapping Named Entity Recognition with Automatically Generated Gazetteer Lists"** - Jenny Rose Finkel
**"Learning from Labeled and Unlabeled Data with Label Propagation"** - Xiaojin Zhu, Zoubin Ghahramani
**"Self-Training with Noisy Student improves ImageNet classification"** - Qizhe Xie, et al
**"Learning from Noisy Labels with Deep Neural Networks: A Survey"** - Jindong Wang, et al
**"Unsupervised Data Augmentation for Consistency Training"** - Qizhe Xie, et al
**"MixMatch: A Holistic Approach to Semi-Supervised Learning"** - David Berthelot, et al
**"Meta Pseudo Labels"** - Hieu Pham, et al
**"Noisy Student Training: An Efficient Semi-Supervised Learning Method"** - Qizhe Xie, et al
**"Consistency Regularization for Cross-Lingual Fine-Tuning"** - Yuanhe Tian, et al
**"Learning with Noisy Labels Revisited: A Study Using Real-World Human Annotations"** - Jacob Goldberger, et al
**"Weakly Supervised Learning for Cross-Lingual Named Entity Recognition via Knowledge Distillation"** - Zihan Wang, et al
**"Learning from Noisy Labels with Deep Neural Networks: A Survey"** - Jindong Wang, et al
**"Pseudo-Labeling and Confirmation Bias in Deep Semi-Supervised Learning"** - David Oliver, et al
**"Self-Training for Few-Shot Transfer across Extreme Tasks"** - Raphael Shu, et al
**"Learning from Noisy Labels with Deep Neural Networks: A Survey"** - Jindong Wang, et al
**"FixMatch: Simplifying Semi-Supervised Learning with Consistency and Confidence"** - Kihyuk Sohn, et al
These articles should provide a comprehensive overview of the current state of indirectly supervised NLP, including various techniques and methodologies used in the field
